comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: William G. Peel (d. 1916), born in India, son of an English army captain, first Bishop of the Diocese of Mombasa. In 1913-1914, he was involved in the Kikuyu Controversy, in which a conference and communion service held with Scots Church missionaries in British East Africa raised concerns of schism. newspapers.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/2092844

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_George_Peel I also started an article on the event: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kikuyu_heresy
